title: Perfect Aatrox Buffs
body:
I have TONS of ranked matches with him (700).  80 percent of the time, at least, I win my lane easily. Sometimes we go on to win the game, and sometimes my team has no idea how to take advantage of me snowballing. Sometimes I play bad in team fights because I'm red/green color blind and I lose track of where my cursor is on some days.  Riot has yet to bother to allow players to change the god damn color of the cursor--as if that would be SO hard to do. Anyways....

Aatrox is very strong in lane, and very strong in team fights. He can do very well in many team comps, and sometimes carry and end the game in 30 minutes.

I see many suggestions. Some from myself. The thing is, he is just on the cusp of being OP.  But instead of him being OP, he instead has been doomed to be under-powered.  Neither are good.

His main point is sustain. That is what makes Aatrox Aatrox. However, if he gets busted down he can't sustain. If he gets crowd controlled he cant sustain.

I really do like him a lot where he is at....but he is pulled in too many directions. He needs AD for his W...but he needs armor to not be squishy, but he needs tenacity and attack speed so CC doesn't kill him, but he also needs life steal to offset the cost of his Blood Price  (meanwhile, Jax gets to do bonus damage passively with every 3rd hit with no cost...yeah, that's fair).

Furthermore, he is very dependent on landing that Q, which as a very small area of impact and has a pretty long cool down compared to other champions CC, such as Riven.

The solutions are simple and reasonable:

1)Blood well grants attack speed but ALSO, bonus tenacity depending on how full it is

2)Dark Flight Knock up radius and cool down remains the same, but enemies in the larger radius are stunned for 0.5 seconds

3)His Blood Price/Blood Prince toggle should be immediate. Too many times you think you toggled it, but you were CCed at the same time...and you have the wrong one one etc. Its super annoying since you literally can lose a fight because you bonus damaged instead of lifestole or visa-versa

4)Blades of torment can stay as they are

5)Ult rework. Aatrox draws in the blood of his foes, dealing magic damage to nearby enemy champions and filling his Blood Well filling Blood Well by 20% of its maximum value for each enemy hit and forming a blood magic shield absorbing damage

Blood Shield (10% of max health x number of enemies hit)
Magic Damage: 200 / 300 / 400 (+ 100% AP)
Additionally, Aatrox gains bonus attack speed and attack range for 12 seconds.
Attack Speed: 40 / 50 / 60%

These changes keep his play mechanics the same for the most part. The blood magic shield rewards team fighting. Notice that the bonus shield would only be 200 if he was fighting 1v1 while at 2000 hp. Its a small buff at that point, a moderate one 1v2 and a strong one in a full on team fight with a well placed ult.

This is the most reasonable solution that I have come up with. It keeps his play mechanics, makes him a little less susceptible to CC, gives him a tiny bit more CC and gives the player a reason to build HP and provides incentive for team fights and rewards well timed ults.

Aatrox may not be very weak but he sees very little play, specially at higher ranks. So I don't agree that he doesn't need some significant changes, maybe not all buffs but he needs a small rework. I like him thematically and have tried to play him often and make him work so I'll tell you what makes him, as you said, _not satisfying _to me.

Aatrox doesn't know what it wants to be. His W says sustained damage duelist. But he has neither the hyper mobility or inherent tankyness of other champions that are auto dependent duelists like Shyvana, Xin, Yi and Olaf. Equally fed those champions will all do your face in during an extended duel. Against ranged he is too easily kited to survive extended fights. On the other hand all the instant high damage and long cooldowns on the rest of his kit seems to make you want to stack AD and focus on bursting.  But since he doesn't have the escapes an assassin does though he needs to build some tank or die too quickly in teamfights if you attempt to burst their backline.

So his kit seems to be asking you to build sustain, high ad, mobility and tank all at once just to work, and since you can't do that all at once he just  ends being not that good at anything unless you get really fed early. He has enough to make an impact, but it's  rubber-banded by really good sustain during the laning phase and the passive, whatever he can do in actual teamfights and duels there are other champions who can just do it better, there is nothing about him that makes you want to bring him over someone else for the team other than specifically just wanting to play him.

Personally I feel like with his limited mobility, kit and thematics you should make him into a proper tank/fighter. So lower the burst damage on the Q, remove the damage on the R on cast and lower the W damage proc and make him significantly more naturally tanky. The remove the attack speed on his ult so he isn't so reliant on building AD, and give him some something to make him a better engager. Maybe his ult could drain a percentage of life from everyone around him while slowing them or something like that. So that when you pick him you think, we need a sustain damage meat shield that's annoying to kill and will do well against health stacking teams. Some kind of niche or purpose.

What makes you think he's not weak? He has less staring health than Ahri or Akali! He's not played much at low levels, hes not played much at high levels. 

He can go great if you are amazing with him and the team conditions are just right.  Otherwise, you are behind the curve.

I have 700...SEVEN HUNDRED...ranked matches with him. I've tried every possible combo of builds/runes/masteries. He is just not up to snuff.

Well like I said, I do rather like him where he is at. Its just little things such as  W toggle and and ult that is a little underwhelming, since if you miss with the AoE its basically just attack speed.

But I have to ask, why don't you think those buffs are appropriate? Why does Jax get passive damage with his ult? Why does Riven get a lower CD on her Q and not even need mana, let alone costing health? 

Why does he have less starting health than Ahri or Akali?

It just seems like he gets the short end of the stick because he has sustain and a revive.  If he stops attacking he can't sustain, but if hes not careful  he gets killed fast...yet he needs to keep attacking to sustain, but if he dies and revives his attack speed bonus is gone making it hard to sustain....it puts him in tough spot all the time. 

I feel like my opinion should carry some weight regarding all of this. I have tried so many build/rune/mastery combos its insane over the 700..SEVEN HUNDRED...ranked matches. Conclusion: He needs a little bit of help.

The other suggestion would be is to simply reset the cool down on his Q and E upon activating his ult. That would add so much functionality to him.
Why not do something minor like lower the healthcost for the w bonus damage and his e  and see if he will see more play.

I would actually change a few things around with this:

* Passive:
 * Adding tenacity is a really good idea, helps reinforce his identity as the fighter that just keeps on fighting eternally. Something like 30/35/40/45/50/55% bonus tenacity *when at max blood well*. This may seem huge (because to be honest, 55% *is* huge) but the majority of the time he will not be at full blood well (usually more like 2/3rds from what I tend to see), and this also rewards enemies for proccing his revive, thus draining his tenacity.
 * I would suggest actually increasing his Attack speed bonus significantly at later levels, say 30/45/60/75/90/105%, and then *remove* the AS bonus from his ult.

* Q:
 * I think the primary issue with this ability is that it feels so unreliable that you don't want to use it in a fight because of how vulnerable it makes you. Instead of adding a micro-stun, the dash animation should be shortened so that the ability completes more quickly. He'd still be interuptible (healthy play for enemies trying to stop an engage) but it is less punishing and unfair to the Aatrox (you would know that if they interrupted you, it was because they read you well and reacted quickly).

* W:
 * I think rather than just being "immediate" (i.e. no delay between the two stances), what you mean is that it should be toggleable while under the effects of CC, like how Heimerdinger and Karma can activate their ults while CCed because it doesn't provide any immediate effect. This is a good idea and I really like it.
 * The one thing about this that has always really irked me is that the health cost is relative to his bonus AD, which heavily discourages building as any sort of threatening late game DPS fighter. Instead it should cost a flat base plus a % of his current health, much like any of his other abilities.
 * The last thing is that I think his normal heal should only be *doubled* when below 50% health, but also heal him for a % of his bonus health. This system allows damage Aatrox to coexist with drain tank Aatrox in a healthy way, since DPS Aatrox would be allowed to deal damage if he weren't healing so much, and Tank Aatrox would be allowed to exist since his sustain wouldn't be linked solely to his offensive capabilities. This separation is essential to making Aatrox healthy and not the current binary "either OP as hell or trash tier UP" champ he is.

* E:
 * Yeah, this seems fine by my book.

* R: 
 * I love the blood shield idea, but up to 50% max health as a shield on a relatively offensive champ seems like a bit much. Maybe instead have it at more like 7%? Also, is your intent that this shield lasts as long as the rest of his ult?
 * I feel like there is a really missed opportunity to incorporate some team buff style gameplay that would tie in nicely with his lore. Maybe he could create an aura around himself where he heals for any damage his allies deal, or his allies deal bonus damage based on some of his stats, or a combination of those types of effect? You could also go for some sort of enemy debuff, like "Aatrox's attacks and abilities during this time mark enemy units, causing his allies who attack a marked enemy to deal bonus damage equal to X stat (i.e. % of his bonus AD, or % of his max health, or % missing health, etc.), consuming the mark.
 *As I mentioned before, I think his Ult should not have AS on it anymore. Having two mediocre AS buffs generally feels worse than having one significantly powerful steroid of equivalent strength.

I would suggest the shield last as long as his ult or until depleted. If we perma increase his passive attack speed buff, we could add an aura during his ult for his teammates benefits.

Well, if has 2000 hp and gets 200 shield from his ult x5 if he hits all enemies...so yes, that would be 1000 or 50% of his health. It is a lot...but how many times will he actually be able to hit all 5? 

The other option would be to just include an attack speed bonus for nearby champions and reset the cool down on his Q and W upon activating his ult.

Yeah, I was unclear, I meant 7% max health shield per person, or 35% max health for all 5, which feels much more reasonable. Using your 2k HP example, that's a 700 HP shield as opposed to 1000. To me at least it feels like a more realistic value.
Yeah, I agree.

Keep in mind, Aatrox WILL need buffs soon given all of the grievous wounds effects and items that are coming through. The shield is a nice touch, but I'm not too keen on adding CC to Aatrox's kit with the Q... the tenacity is nice though. Overall, this was a well thought-out post. Good job.
The tenacity bonus would be my 1st choice if I could only have one of the buffs I listed.
